title: Polar Visible Imaging System Earth Camera Key Parameter - Louis A. Frank (The University of Iowa)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/polar/vis/vis_k1/1996/po_k1_vis_19960430_v03.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 9.5785% of the 25 timesteps. Cadence = 267500 [ms] = PT4M27.5S.
info.contact: Louis A. Frank @ The University of Iowa

parameters.name: AltF
parameters.description: Presumed altitude of emissions (also quickly shows times when images are available)

parameters.name: Image_Counts
parameters.description: Earth Camera UV Images (quasi-log cnts), small format display with click-expand (~4 min. res.)

parameters.name: Image_CountsF
parameters.description: --> Larger format display with click-expand, no geographic registration. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Mapped_ImageO
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) With geographic grid overlay. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Mapped_Image
parameters.description: --> [DO NOT USE: UNDER-DEVELOPMENT] Test Display. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Mapped_ImageP
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) Azimuthal projection to geographic (fixed sun orientation). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon', 'Intens_Table']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Mapped_ImageM
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) Azimuthal projection to magnetic LT and invariant lat. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Movie_Image
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) Movie display of images, no geographic registration. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Mapped_MovieO
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) Movie, with geographic grid overlay. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) Movie, azimuthal projection to geographic (fixed sun orientation). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon', 'Intens_Table']. parameters.name: Mapped_MovieM
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) Movie, azimuthal projection to magnetic LT and invariant lat. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: IImage_Counts
parameters.description: Earth Camera UV Images (kRay), small format display with click-expand (~4 min. res.). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_plain_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Intens_Table']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: IImage_CountsF
parameters.description: --> Larger format display with click-expand, no geographic registration. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_plain_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Intens_Table']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Image Pixel Counts in KiloRayleighs (large format)

parameters.name: Mapped_IImageO
parameters.description: --> (USE SHORT TIME SPANS) With geographic grid overlay. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function create_plmap_vis (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Image_Counts', 'Geo_Lat', 'Geo_Lon', 'Intens_Table']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: PPitch
parameters.description: Platform pointing angle from nadir

parameters.name: SC_Pos_GCI
parameters.description: GCI position vector of Polar spacecraft in kilometers.

parameters.name: SC_Vel_GCI
parameters.description: GCI velocity vector of Polar spacecraft in km/sec.

parameters.name: SC_SpinV_GCI
parameters.description: GCI spin axis unit vector of Polar spacecraft.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: Image header bytes
